facility.facility_notes: The K-12 Athletic Complex is approximately 80 years old. Bond passed November 2024 for $17.3M in athletic complex improvements including bleacher replacement, new restrooms, locker rooms, and concessions. Track was replaced in 2024. Currently in design development phase with Perkins & Will. Lighting not explicitly mentioned in current scope but facility modernization is underway.

deal_risk_flags: Lighting may not be in current project scope and could require additional funding approval
School board and superintendent approval required for scope changes

facility_hypothesis.statement: Grandview Heights Schools needs LED stadium lighting for Bobcat Stadium because the 80-year-old athletic complex is undergoing $17.3M in modernization improvements and lighting would complement the new bleachers, track, and facilities being installed. Expected project size: $200K-$350K.
facility_hypothesis.primary_driver: Major facility modernization project with active bond funding

decision_maker.name: Logan Dunn
decision_maker.title: Athletic Director
decision_maker.notes: Current AD overseeing athletic complex renovation. Brad Bertani, former AD (2015 AD of the Year) initiated the facility planning committee in 2017. Superintendent Andy Culp has final project authority.

secondary_contacts.name: Andy Culp
secondary_contacts.title: Superintendent
secondary_contacts.role_in_decision: Final approval authority and project oversight

secondary_contacts.name: Beth Collier
secondary_contacts.title: Treasurer
secondary_contacts.role_in_decision: Budget approval and bond fund allocation

sales_readiness.opportunity_summary: Active $17.3M athletic complex modernization with bond funding secured. Design development phase underway. Perfect timing to position LED lighting as a value-add to complete the facility transformation.
key_assumptions: Bond funds can accommodate lighting within existing scope or as a change order
AD and Superintendent prioritize complete facility modernization
Current lighting system is due for replacement
required_validation: Current lighting specifications and condition assessment
Whether lighting is already planned in current scope
Remaining bond fund flexibility for scope additions
discovery_questions: With the athletic complex modernization underway, what are your plans for the stadium lighting system?
How old is the current lighting infrastructure at Bobcat Stadium?
Is there flexibility in the $17.3M bond allocation to include lighting upgrades?
What is the expected construction timeline for the stadium improvements?
Are you planning any broadcast or streaming capabilities that would require better lighting?

personalization_hooks: Reference the recent bond passage and community support
Congratulate on boys soccer state championships (2021, 2022)
Reference proximity to Cincinnati for installation support
outreach.recommended_approach: Email to AD referencing the ongoing athletic complex project, offering a complimentary lighting assessment to determine if current system should be included in modernization scope. Follow up with call to discuss energy savings and broadcast capability options.

next_action.notes: A1 tier with active bond funding and construction timeline approaching. Design phase is ideal time to add lighting to scope.

facility.primary_venue: Donnell Stadium (shared with Findlay High School)
facility.facility_notes: Donnell Stadium opened in 1928 and is shared with Findlay High School. Seats 7,500. The stadium is 3.5 miles from campus, which affects student attendance. AD Jim Givens has successfully raised $1.3M+ for practice facility improvements (Dick Strahm Champions Field completed 2023). Athletic department has demonstrated fundraising capability and facility investment priority.

deal_risk_flags: Shared stadium with Findlay High School complicates decision making
New head football coach (Tyler Johns) hired December 2025 may shift priorities
Off-campus location may reduce university investment priority

facility_hypothesis.statement: University of Findlay needs LED stadium lighting for Donnell Stadium because the 1928 facility with 28-year-old lighting systems needs modernization to improve night game attendance, broadcast capability, and competitive positioning in the G-MAC. Expected project size: $300K-$500K.
facility_hypothesis.primary_driver: Facility modernization to improve game day experience and recruiting

decision_maker.name: Jim Givens
decision_maker.title: Director of Athletics
decision_maker.notes: AD since January 2023, previously Senior Associate AD for 25 years. Kent State baseball alum, former Detroit Tigers organization player. Proven fundraiser who raised $1.3M+ for Dick Strahm Champions Field. Has stated desire to improve game day experience and attendance.

secondary_contacts.name: Brandi Laurita
secondary_contacts.title: Vice President for Student Affairs and Athletics / Senior Woman Administrator

secondary_contacts.name: Katherine Fell, Ph.D.
secondary_contacts.title: University President
secondary_contacts.role_in_decision: Final approval for major capital projects

sales_readiness.opportunity_summary: Strong AD with proven fundraising track record looking to improve game day experience. Recent $1.3M practice facility demonstrates capital project capability. Aging shared stadium lighting presents modernization opportunity.
key_assumptions: Shared stadium agreement allows UF to fund lighting improvements
Athletic department has fundraising capacity for additional projects
Improved lighting would enhance recruiting and night game attendance
required_validation: Current lighting specifications and last upgrade date
Stadium sharing agreement terms with Findlay High School
Athletic department capital project priorities for 2026-2027
discovery_questions: With your success fundraising for Dick Strahm Champions Field, what stadium improvements are next on your list?
How does the shared arrangement with Findlay High School work for facility improvements?
What role does night game quality play in your recruiting efforts?
Are there any broadcast or streaming requirements driving facility decisions?
What is the current condition of the stadium lighting system?

timing_triggers: New head football coach Tyler Johns hired December 2025
Seven home games scheduled for 2025 season
Continued emphasis on improving game day experience
personalization_hooks: Congratulate on successful Dick Strahm Champions Field project
Mention energy savings for shared facility benefiting both UF and high school
Note four NAIA national football championships legacy
outreach.recommended_approach: Email to Jim Givens referencing his successful facility improvements and offering energy and lighting analysis for Donnell Stadium. Position as next phase of facility enhancement following practice field success.

next_action.notes: A2 tier with strong facility investment history. New coach hiring may present opportunity for facility discussion.

facility.facility_notes: The lighted soccer stadium opened in 2002 with track added in 2004. Seats 2,000 with field-level student seating, press box, electronic scoreboard. Has hosted multiple G-MAC and NCCAA championships and OHSAA state soccer playoffs. Indoor Doden Field House flooring replaced in 2018. No on-campus football stadium (uses Thurman Munson Stadium in Canton for some events). First generation LED lighting from 2002 may be due for upgrade to current technology.

deal_risk_flags: Current lighting may still be functional (23 years but LED)
No active capital campaign or bond measure identified
Private Christian university may have different budget cycles

facility_hypothesis.statement: Cedarville University needs LED lighting upgrade for Yellow Jacket Soccer Complex because the 2002 first-generation LED system is now 23 years old and modern LED technology offers significantly better efficiency, light quality, and broadcast capability for their championship-hosting venue. Expected project size: $150K-$300K.

decision_maker.name: Athletic Director
decision_maker.title: Director of Athletics
decision_maker.notes: AD contact information needs to be researched. University is Christ-centered with strong values alignment. Athletic department competes in NCAA Division II G-MAC.

sales_readiness.opportunity_summary: Championship-caliber facility with aging first-generation LED lighting. Venue regularly hosts conference and regional championships. Opportunity to position LED-to-LED upgrade for improved efficiency and broadcast quality.
key_assumptions: 2002 lighting system is approaching end of optimal performance
University values stewardship and would appreciate energy savings
Championship hosting requirements may drive upgrade interest
required_validation: Current lighting system specifications and performance
AD contact information and organizational structure
discovery_questions: How is the 2002 stadium lighting system performing for your evening events?
What are your lighting requirements when hosting G-MAC or NCCAA championships?
How does energy stewardship factor into your facility decisions?
What facility improvements are you considering over the next 2 to 3 years?
Do you have any broadcast or streaming requirements that require specific lighting levels?

timing_triggers: Regular G-MAC and NCCAA championship hosting
23-year-old lighting system approaching typical replacement cycle
personalization_hooks: Position energy savings as stewardship alignment with Christian mission
Mention similar projects at faith-based institutions
Note geographic proximity to Cincinnati metro area
outreach.recommended_approach: Research AD contact information, then reach out with educational content about LED-to-LED upgrades and energy savings. Position as long-term stewardship investment rather than urgent need.

next_action.notes: B tier prospect. Requires additional research to identify AD and validate lighting system age/condition before outreach.
